column5: With our heat wave we decided to go out last evening at 5.It was still a scorcher but knew it would get cooler.Tried some muskie fishing and after 6 of them coming to the boat i had a feeling they wernt goìng to bite in that almost 80 f water temp.actually water is a bit to warm now for them.So decided to try for lake trout and was headed a short distance to a trout waypoint and already saw trout on my lowrance and stop to try them.my wife dropped her tube down and it got taken right away.put spot lock on and preceded to get 17 lakers within a hour.thats pretty good action.Saw a cow moose and a calf but a bit to far for cell phone pics and didnt want to disturb them getting any closer.Turned out to be a fun evening and did get much cooler.
John there's no social distancing between you and the fish that's a proven fact,you and the wife could make some great fishing shows,starring mrs Jakob's and you on the camera
Thàt would be fun for sure.
Great evening Bill.Lake trout give you a real good fight compared to most fish and they dont give up.And are pretty eating to.We had some tonight in the bbq.
John it's not fair you eat laker for supper and I had to settle for a 2 pound sucker for supper that was full of bones,dam
Nice trout. Keep the pictures coming since we can't get to Canada to try our luck..
Try my best Lazy.we were going to go this evening but some weather blew in raining now maybe tomorrow
